messages.ssml: <speak>According to the World Health Organization, to date, there is no specific medicine to prevent or treat <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub>. However, those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms. People with serious illness should be hospitalized. Most patients recover thanks to supportive care. Antibiotics do not work against viruses; they only work on bacterial infections. <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub> is caused by a virus, so antibiotics do not work. Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub>. They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection. </speak>

messages.displayText: According to the World Health Organization, to date, there is no specific medicine to prevent or treat COVID-19. However, those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms. People with serious illness should be hospitalized. Most patients recover thanks to supportive care. Antibiotics do not work against viruses; they only work on bacterial infections. COVID-19 is caused by a virus, so antibiotics do not work. Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of COVID-19. They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection.

messages.destinationName: WHO's response on possible treatment for coronavirus

messages.speech: According to the World Health Organization, to date, there is no specific medicine to prevent or treat COVID-19. However, those affected should receive care to relieve symptoms. People with serious illness should be hospitalized. Most patients recover thanks to supportive care. Antibiotics do not work against viruses; they only work on bacterial infections. COVID-19 is caused by a virus, so antibiotics do not work. Antibiotics should not be used as a means of prevention or treatment of COVID-19. They should only be used as directed by a physician to treat a bacterial infection.
